intro: Zollikoferia korovinii, commonly known as the Siberian lily, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Zollikoferia korovinii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with cool, temperate conditions.
